name: places/ChIJgZaA5xpZwokREXgwj4W9DH4
adrFormatAddress: 829 9th Ave, New York, NY 10019-5601, USA

originalText.text:
WARNING: This place is a piece of sh.....
I brought my scooter 4 times with the same problem and also the tires keep getting flat even less than one month after they charge me $60 dollars to "fix it" the owner doesn't know about scooters or bike and was unable to explain why the problem keep happening. No responsibility was taken. I took the scooter somewhere else and never had the problem again. You been warned! Good luck

originalText.text: This place was a lifesaver! It is one of the few in the city open past 6pm. I was riding around Central Park, but after my Tern foldable back bike tire kept deflating I started calling bike shops to get it fixed. That’s when I realized most of the bike shops were already closed. NYC Bike and Scooter shop fixed the tire in front of me. It took 10 minutes and they also had an extra inner tube and a patch kit for sale.  I was going to ride the Five Borough Bike Tour the next day and thanks to Sal and Pedro I actually am!!!

originalText.text:
I've been to this repair shop about four times in the past year, this is my overall assessment.

If you have a break issue or a flat tire on your nonmotorized wheel this place will get the job done fairly well. If you have a flat on your motor wheel and your scooter is not a Segway Ninebot model please understand that they will have a basic understanding of how to fix it but it might not always be repaired correctly due to there being so many different brand models and designs, they're learning and teaching each other as they go. I had a flat on my motorized rear wheel, they fixed it but the alignment is slightly off and the wheel wobbles slightly, its not serious enough to take it back though and have it disassembled again. Motor wheel disassembling is a long and sensitive process because of the motor.

My reason for giving the repair shop 3 stars is because of the way they talk to you sometimes. If they're overworked or stressed they talk to you in a disrepectful or dismissive way, this is the main reason why I don't like coming here unless its an emergency. Prices also seem to vary slightly at times. Lastly I would recommend that they have a online scheduler for repairs. When you go you won't know if they'll be able to repair in the next hour or within the day.

If you're struggling with electric scooter repairs try looking into Apollo scooters, they have an in person repair center in Queens and their new scooters are tubeless and therefore won't have flats. Also look into Unagi which leases scooters and will send you a new one within a few days if anything goes wrong with the one you have (these are also tubeless).

Conclusion, this is a good option in an emergency but for very technical repairs or if you'e looking for staff that are friendly and respectful consider looking for other repair shops in Manhattan or Queens.

originalText.text:
They  changed the tire and inner tube, but put the tube in the wrong way, so now the valve is blocked by the disc - no way to get air in that tire. They also didn’t adjust the disc break, so the scooter is not usable. This seems unnecessarily sloppy and means I’ll need to fix it myself or go back.

Update: I brought it back and they fixed it for free. Thank you!

originalText.text:
The attitude of the people in this store is absolutely disgusting. They speak to you like you’re a toddler instead of actually explaining why they can’t do what they do. Not even a toddler, an angry parent yelling at their teenager. Sorry for asking questions. Will not be returning.
Every time I went in to fix something they come up with a different reason that they don’t do this or that. The only thing they do is fix a basic chain or a flat tire. What’s worse is that they make you buy a whole new piece and then they can’t even fix that. What a load of bullocks.
